+2: Create a 1/1 green Elf Druid creature token with "{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool."
−2: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Life grows everywhere. My kin merely find those places where it grows strongest."
—Nissa Revane
mainBoard.name: Elvish Mystic
mainBoard.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
mainBoard.text: {T}: Add {G}.

mainBoard.flavorText: The spires of Ravnica are no different from the tall trees of other planes. The elves navigate and protect them just the same.
mainBoard.name: Elvish Skysweeper
mainBoard.originalText: {4}{G}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target creature with flying.
mainBoard.text: {4}{G}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target creature with flying.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"The more our numbers grow, the more I gain hope that Volrath and his cursed stronghold will one day fall."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
mainBoard.name: Essence Warden
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.

mainBoard.text: Whenever another creature enters, you gain 1 life.

mainBoard.name: Joraga Warcaller
mainBoard.originalText:
Multikicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Joraga Warcaller enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each time it was kicked.
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1 for each +1/+1 counter on Joraga Warcaller.

rulings.text: The last ability counts the total number of +1/+1 counters on Joraga Warcaller, not just the ones placed on it as a result of its "enters" ability.

mainBoard.text:
Multikicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Joraga Warcaller enters with a +1/+1 counter on it for each time it was kicked.

mainBoard.flavorText:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing
mainBoard.name: Llanowar Elves
mainBoard.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
mainBoard.text: {T}: Add {G}.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"He has been to the heart of the wood. Did you truly expect to wield power over him?"
—Oakhide druid
mainBoard.name: Sylvan Safekeeper
mainBoard.originalText: Sacrifice a land: Target creature you control gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
mainBoard.text: Sacrifice a land: Target creature you control gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

mainBoard.flavorText: "From a tiny sprout, the greatest trees grow and flourish. May the seeds of your mind be equally fruitful."
mainBoard.name: Elvish Visionary
mainBoard.originalText: When Elvish Visionary enters the battlefield, draw a card.
mainBoard.text: When Elvish Visionary enters, draw a card.

mainBoard.flavorText: Titania rewards all who honor the forest by making them a living part of it.
mainBoard.name: Priest of Titania
mainBoard.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each Elf on the battlefield.

rulings.text: Priest of Titania's ability counts all Elves on the battlefield. This includes Priest of Titania itself as well as Elves controlled by other players.

Priest of Titania's ability is a mana ability. It doesn't use the stack and players can't respond to it. Notably, this means other players can't try to remove Elves from the battlefield after you activate this ability but before it resolves.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Add {G} for each Elf on the battlefield.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Not all paths are found on the forest floor."
mainBoard.name: Sylvan Ranger
mainBoard.originalText: When Sylvan Ranger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
mainBoard.text: When Sylvan Ranger enters, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

mainBoard.flavorText: Their arrows are tipped with basilisk eyes and fletched with cockatrice feathers.
mainBoard.name: Thornweald Archer
mainBoard.originalText:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
mainBoard.text: Reach, deathtouch

mainBoard.flavorText: "Close your ears to the voice of greed, and you can turn a gift for one into a gift for many."
mainBoard.name: Wellwisher
mainBoard.originalText: {T}: You gain 1 life for each Elf on the battlefield.
mainBoard.text: {T}: You gain 1 life for each Elf on the battlefield.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Verdant bloom does exist. It merely hides for its own safety."
mainBoard.name: Farhaven Elf
mainBoard.originalText: When Farhaven Elf enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. If you do, shuffle your library.
mainBoard.text: When Farhaven Elf enters, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

mainBoard.flavorText: In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.
mainBoard.name: Imperious Perfect
mainBoard.originalText:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{G}, {T}: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

rulings.text: Because damage remains marked on a creature until the damage is removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to Elves you control may become lethal if Imperious Perfect leaves the battlefield during that turn.

mainBoard.text:
Other Elves you control get +1/+1.
{G}, {T}: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

mainBoard.flavorText: "What was once formed by masons, shaped by smiths, or given life by mages, I will return to the embrace of the earth."
mainBoard.name: Reclamation Sage
mainBoard.originalText: When Reclamation Sage enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.
mainBoard.text: When Reclamation Sage enters, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.

mainBoard.flavorText: Even through the Mirari's voice, the elves still hear the call of their kinship.
mainBoard.name: Timberwatch Elf
mainBoard.originalText: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves on the battlefield.

rulings.text: The number of Elves on the battlefield is counted only as Timberwatch Elf’s ability resolves. If Timberwatch Elf is still on the battlefield, it’ll count itself.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves on the battlefield.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"What do a hero and an arrow have in common? In times of war are many more made."
—Elvish riddle
mainBoard.name: Titania's Chosen
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever a player casts a green spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Titania's Chosen.
mainBoard.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Titania's Chosen.

mainBoard.flavorText: Every branch a crossroads, every vine a swift steed.
mainBoard.name: Wood Elves
mainBoard.originalText: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

mainBoard.text: When Wood Elves enters, search your library for a Forest card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

mainBoard.flavorText: He knows the name of every elf born in the last four centuries. More importantly, they all know his.
mainBoard.name: Elvish Archdruid
mainBoard.originalText:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each Elf you control.

rulings.text: Elvish Archdruid's first ability affects only other Elves you control. However, Elvish Archdruid's second ability counts all Elves you control — including itself.
Elvish Archdruid's activated ability is a mana ability. It doesn't use the stack and players can't respond to it.

mainBoard.text:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Add {G} for each Elf you control.

mainBoard.flavorText: The infamous Ezuri commands the highest bounty the vedalken have ever placed upon an outlaw.
mainBoard.name: Ezuri, Renegade Leader
mainBoard.originalText:
{G}: Regenerate another target Elf.
{2}{G}{G}{G}: Elf creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

rulings.text: Ezuri's first ability can't affect itself, but its second ability does.

Only Elf creatures you control when the last ability resolves will get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn. Non-Elf creatures that become Elves or Elf creatures that enter under your control later in the turn won't get the bonuses.

mainBoard.text:
{G}: Regenerate another target Elf.
{2}{G}{G}{G}: Elf creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: "The light of beauty protects our journeys through darkness."
mainBoard.name: Drove of Elves
mainBoard.originalText:
Hexproof
Drove of Elves's power and toughness are each equal to the number of green permanents you control.
mainBoard.text:
Hexproof
Drove of Elves's power and toughness are each equal to the number of green permanents you control.

mainBoard.flavorText: Elves of the immaculate class weave flora into living creatures—sometimes to endorse an elite warrior, sometimes to create a breathing work of art.
mainBoard.name: Immaculate Magistrate
mainBoard.originalText: {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature for each Elf you control.

rulings.text: The number of counters to put on the target creature is determined only as Immaculate Magistrate's ability resolves. Elves coming and going later won't cause that creature to gain or lose +1/+1 counters.
The target creature doesn't have to be an Elf.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature for each Elf you control.

mainBoard.name: Wren's Run Packmaster
mainBoard.originalText:
Champion an Elf (When this creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Elf you control. When this creature leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
{2}{G}: Create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
Wolves you control have deathtouch.

rulings.text: Wren's Run Packmaster gives deathtouch to all Wolf permanents you control, not just the tokens it creates.

A Wolf's deathtouch ability will apply if both Wren's Run Packmaster and that Wolf are on the battlefield at the time the Wolf deals damage. The creature dealt damage by the Wolf will be destroyed the next time state-based actions are checked, even if the Wolf or Wren's Run Packmaster leaves the battlefield.

mainBoard.text:
Champion an Elf (When this creature enters, sacrifice it unless you exile another Elf you control. When this creature leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
{2}{G}: Create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
Wolves you control have deathtouch.

mainBoard.flavorText: From the highest tiers of Dawn's Light Palace to the deepest shade of Wren's Run, the silver notes of the horn shimmer through the air, and all who hear it feel its pull.
mainBoard.name: Lys Alana Huntmaster
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever you cast an Elf spell, you may create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

rulings.text: Lys Alana Huntmaster’s ability will resolve before the Elf spell that caused it to trigger.

mainBoard.text: Whenever you cast an Elf spell, you may create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Beauty determines value, and we determine beauty."
mainBoard.name: Masked Admirers
mainBoard.originalText:
When Masked Admirers enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {G}{G}. If you do, return Masked Admirers from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: Masked Admirers will return to your hand before the creature spell you cast resolves.
The second triggered ability triggers only if Masked Admirers is in your graveyard when you cast a creature spell.

mainBoard.text:
When Masked Admirers enters, draw a card.
Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {G}{G}. If you do, return Masked Admirers from your graveyard to your hand.

mainBoard.name: Wolfbriar Elemental
mainBoard.originalText:
Multikicker {G} (You may pay an additional {G} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
When Wolfbriar Elemental enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token for each time it was kicked.
mainBoard.text:
Multikicker {G} (You may pay an additional {G} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
When Wolfbriar Elemental enters, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token for each time it was kicked.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"I saw the devastation when the juggernauts crashed the walls of An Karras. Then I got to thinking."
—Janji, sylvan druid
mainBoard.name: Creeperhulk
mainBoard.originalText:
Trample
{1}{G}: Until end of turn, target creature you control has base power and toughness 5/5 and gains trample.

rulings.text: Effects that modify the target creature’s power and/or toughness, such as the effect of Giant Growth or Glorious Anthem, will apply to the creature no matter when they started applying. The same is true for counters that affect the target creature’s power and toughness and effects that switch its power and toughness.

The activated ability overwrites all previous effects that set the target creature’s base power and/or toughness to specific values. Other effects that set its base power and/or toughness that start to apply after Creeperhulk’s ability resolves will overwrite Creeperhulk’s effect.

mainBoard.text:
Trample
{1}{G}: Until end of turn, target creature you control has base power and toughness 5/5 and gains trample.

mainBoard.flavorText: By the time the spider comes to slurp up its dinner, its victims have been partially dissolved by acidic silk.
mainBoard.name: Silklash Spider
mainBoard.originalText:
Reach
{X}{G}{G}: Silklash Spider deals X damage to each creature with flying.
mainBoard.text:
Reach
{X}{G}{G}: Silklash Spider deals X damage to each creature with flying.

mainBoard.name: Titania, Protector of Argoth
mainBoard.originalText:
When Titania, Protector of Argoth enters the battlefield, return target land card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Whenever a land you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, create a 5/3 green Elemental creature token.
mainBoard.text:
When Titania, Protector of Argoth enters, return target land card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Whenever a land you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, create a 5/3 green Elemental creature token.

mainBoard.flavorText: It claws at the earth in a vain attempt to reclaim what it once was.
mainBoard.name: Grave Sifter
mainBoard.originalText: When Grave Sifter enters the battlefield, each player chooses a creature type and returns any number of cards of that type from his or her graveyard to his or her hand.

rulings.text: The creature type each player chooses applies only to that player. For example, if another player chose Elf, you wouldn’t return Elf cards to your hand unless you also chose Elf (or if an Elf card in your graveyard also had the creature type you chose).

mainBoard.text: When Grave Sifter enters, each player chooses a creature type and returns any number of cards of that type from their graveyard to their hand.

mainBoard.flavorText: For each creature that arrives in its audience, the sage imparts another piece of ancient wisdom for all to hear.
mainBoard.name: Primordial Sage
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may draw a card.
mainBoard.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may draw a card.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"When the land is angry, so are they."
—Nissa Revane
mainBoard.name: Rampaging Baloths
mainBoard.originalText:
Trample
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may create a 4/4 green Beast creature token.

rulings.text: The landfall ability triggers whenever a land enters under your control for any reason. It triggers whenever you play a land, as well as whenever a spell or ability (such as Rampant Growth) causes you to put a land onto the battlefield under your control. It will even trigger when a spell or ability causes another player to put a land onto the battlefield under your control (as can happen with Yavimaya Dryad's ability, for example).

When a land enters under your control, each landfall ability of the permanents you control will trigger. You can put them on the stack in any order. The last ability you put on the stack will be the first one that resolves.

mainBoard.text:
Trample
Landfall — Whenever a land you control enters, you may create a 4/4 green Beast creature token.

mainBoard.flavorText: It's there when a seed sprouts, when gourds ripen on the vines, and when the reapers cut the grains under the Harvest Moon.
mainBoard.name: Soul of the Harvest
mainBoard.originalText:
Trample
Whenever another nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.

rulings.text: A creature card that enters as a copy of a token creature is still a nontoken creature. You'll be able to draw a card.

mainBoard.text:
Trample
Whenever another nontoken creature you control enters, you may draw a card.

mainBoard.flavorText: If you hear it, it's too late.
mainBoard.name: Thunderfoot Baloth
mainBoard.originalText:
Trample
Lieutenant — As long as you control your commander, Thunderfoot Baloth gets +2/+2 and other creatures you control get +2/+2 and have trample.

rulings.text: If a triggered ability granted by a lieutenant ability triggers, and in response to that trigger you lose control of your commander (causing the lieutenant to lose that ability), that triggered ability will still resolve.

If you gain control of a creature with a lieutenant ability owned by another player, that ability will check to see if you control your commander and will apply if you do. It won't check whether its owner controls their commander.

If you lose control of your commander, lieutenant abilities of creatures you control will immediately stop applying. If this causes a creature's toughness to become less than or equal to the amount of damage marked on it, the creature will be destroyed.
Lieutenant abilities apply only if your commander is on the battlefield and under your control.
Lieutenant abilities refer only to whether you control your commander, not any other player's commander.

mainBoard.text:
Trample
Lieutenant — As long as you control your commander, Thunderfoot Baloth gets +2/+2 and other creatures you control get +2/+2 and have trample.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Hold the line, hold the li—"
—General Srok, last words
mainBoard.name: Siege Behemoth
mainBoard.originalText:
Hexproof
As long as Siege Behemoth is attacking, for each creature you control, you may have that creature assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: You decide whether to assign a creature’s combat damage as though it weren’t blocked just before it assigns that damage. You may make a different choice for each creature you control—that is, you may have none, some, or all of those creatures assign combat damage as though they weren’t blocked.

mainBoard.text:
Hexproof
As long as Siege Behemoth is attacking, for each creature you control, you may have that creature assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

mainBoard.name: Tornado Elemental
mainBoard.originalText:
When Tornado Elemental enters the battlefield, it deals 6 damage to each creature with flying.
You may have Tornado Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned “as though it weren’t blocked”.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can’t split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

mainBoard.text:
When Tornado Elemental enters, it deals 6 damage to each creature with flying.
You may have Tornado Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

mainBoard.name: Terastodon
mainBoard.originalText: When Terastodon enters the battlefield, you may destroy up to three target noncreature permanents. For each permanent put into a graveyard this way, its controller creates a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.

rulings.text: The targeted permanents may be controlled by different players.

If a targeted permanent has indestructible or regenerates, its controller won't get an Elephant token for it. Similarly, if the targeted permanent is destroyed but a replacement effect moves it to a different zone instead of its owner's graveyard, its controller won't get an Elephant token for it.

mainBoard.text: When Terastodon enters, you may destroy up to three target noncreature permanents. For each permanent put into a graveyard this way, its controller creates a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.

mainBoard.flavorText: Pharika has written her secrets on its bones so that only the worthy may discover them.
mainBoard.name: Lifeblood Hydra
mainBoard.originalText:
Trample
Lifeblood Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
When Lifeblood Hydra dies, you gain life and draw cards equal to its power.

rulings.text: Use Lifeblood Hydra’s power when it died (including any +1/+1 counters it had) to determine how much life to gain and how many cards to draw.

mainBoard.text:
Trample
Lifeblood Hydra enters with X +1/+1 counters on it.
When Lifeblood Hydra dies, you gain life and draw cards equal to its power.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Eyeblights are easy to track. Just follow the imperfections."
mainBoard.name: Hunting Triad
mainBoard.originalText:
Create three 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature tokens.
Reinforce 3—{3}{G} ({3}{G}, Discard this card: Put three +1/+1 counters on target creature.)

rulings.text: Kindred is a card type that allows noncreature cards to have creature types. For example, Echoes of Eternity is an Eldrazi (although not a creature) while on the battlefield and an Eldrazi card (although not a creature card) in zones other than the battlefield.
This cards was originally printed with the "tribal" card type. That card type has been replaced with "kindred". This change does not affect the gameplay function of this card.
While it appears only on cards that already have other card types, kindred is a card type and will be counted by effects that refer to the number of card types among cards in a zone.

mainBoard.text:
Create three 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature tokens.
Reinforce 3—{3}{G} ({3}{G}, Discard this card: Put three +1/+1 counters on target creature.)

mainBoard.flavorText: Urza tried to rule the air, but Gaea taught him that she controlled all the elements.
mainBoard.name: Whirlwind
mainBoard.originalText: Destroy all creatures with flying.
mainBoard.text: Destroy all creatures with flying.

mainBoard.name: Overwhelming Stampede
mainBoard.originalText: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.

rulings.text: You check the power of your creatures as Overwhelming Stampede resolves. For example, if you control a 2/1 creature, a 2/2 creature, a 2/4 creature, a 4/1 creature, a 5/5 creature, and a 5/6 creature at that time, each of your creatures gets +5/+5 and gains trample until end of turn.

mainBoard.text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.

mainBoard.flavorText: Nature doesn't walk.
mainBoard.name: Overrun
mainBoard.originalText: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

rulings.text: Overrun affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won’t affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

mainBoard.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Nothing in nature goes to waste, not even the rotting corpse of a good-for-nothing, blood-sucking vampire."
—Halana of Ulvenwald
mainBoard.name: Grim Flowering
mainBoard.originalText: Draw a card for each creature card in your graveyard.

rulings.text: Count the number of creature cards in your graveyard when Grim Flowering resolves.

mainBoard.text: Draw a card for each creature card in your graveyard.

mainBoard.flavorText: "The beasts of the wild are my senses. It is through their eyes that all knowledge shall come to me."
mainBoard.name: Collective Unconscious
mainBoard.originalText: Draw a card for each creature you control.
mainBoard.text: Draw a card for each creature you control.

mainBoard.flavorText: Massive, mindless, and imbued with one terrible purpose.
mainBoard.name: Desert Twister
mainBoard.originalText: Destroy target permanent.
mainBoard.text: Destroy target permanent.

mainBoard.name: Wave of Vitriol
mainBoard.originalText: Each player sacrifices all artifacts, enchantments, and nonbasic lands he or she controls. For each land sacrificed this way, its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.
mainBoard.text: Each player sacrifices all artifacts, enchantments, and nonbasic lands they control. For each land sacrificed this way, its controller may search their library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then each player who searched their library this way shuffles.

mainBoard.flavorText: As the Phyrexian contagion corroded Karn's body, the praetors whispered psalms to corrupt his mind.
mainBoard.name: Praetor's Counsel
mainBoard.originalText: Return all cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Praetor's Counsel. You have no maximum hand size for the rest of the game.

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then resolve Praetor's Counsel, you have no maximum hand size. However, if those events happened in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.
Later effects that modify your maximum hand size, but don't set it to a specific number, will have no effect.

mainBoard.text: Return all cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Praetor's Counsel. You have no maximum hand size for the rest of the game.

mainBoard.name: Sylvan Offering
mainBoard.originalText:
Choose an opponent. You and that player each create an X/X green Treefolk creature token.
Choose an opponent. You and that player each create X 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature tokens.

rulings.text: You choose the opponents for each effect as the spell resolves.
You may choose the same opponent for each of the effects, or you may choose different opponents. None of the affected players are targets of the spell.

mainBoard.text:
Choose an opponent. You and that player each create an X/X green Treefolk creature token.
Choose an opponent. You and that player each create X 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature tokens.

mainBoard.flavorText: No spot in nature is truly barren.
mainBoard.name: Harrow
mainBoard.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Harrow, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
The sacrifice of a land is part of the cost of casting Harrow. You can't pay this cost more than once to get a multiple effect.
The two lands do not count toward your normal one land you can play each turn.

mainBoard.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

mainBoard.flavorText: A scavenger's favorite appetizer is death.
mainBoard.name: Fresh Meat
mainBoard.originalText: Create a 3/3 green Beast creature token for each creature put into your graveyard from the battlefield this turn.

rulings.text: Fresh Meat counts all creatures you owned that went to the graveyard this turn, including creature tokens that entered under your control and nontoken creatures you owned but didn't control.

mainBoard.text: Create a 3/3 green Beast creature token for each creature put into your graveyard from the battlefield this turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: The mind is a beautiful bounty encased in an annoying bone container.
mainBoard.name: Skullclamp

mainBoard.flavorText: Lost to time is the artificer's art of trapping light from a distant star in a ring of purest gold.
mainBoard.name: Sol Ring
mainBoard.originalText: {T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.
mainBoard.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}.

mainBoard.name: Emerald Medallion
mainBoard.originalText: Green spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

rulings.text: If a spell you cast has {X} in its mana cost, you choose the value of X before calculating the spell's total cost.

If there are additional costs to cast a spell, or if the cost to cast a spell is increased by an effect (such as the one created by Thalia, Guardian of Thraben's ability), apply those increases before applying cost reductions.
The ability can't reduce the amount of colored mana you pay for a spell. It reduces only the generic mana component of that cost.
The ability doesn't change the mana cost or mana value of any spell. It changes only the total cost you pay.
The cost reduction can apply to alternative costs such as flashback costs.

mainBoard.text: Green spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"There is great wisdom in rushing headlong into combat . . . if you're prepared."
—Kenjek, captain of the Thousand Swords
mainBoard.name: Swiftfoot Boots
mainBoard.originalText:
Equipped creature has hexproof and haste.
Equip {1}

rulings.text: If a creature enters the battlefield under your control and gains haste, but then loses it before attacking, it won't be able to attack that turn. This means that you can't use one Swiftfoot Boots to allow two new creatures to attack in the same turn.

mainBoard.text:
Equipped creature has hexproof and haste. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Equip {1}

mainBoard.flavorText: It harmonizes with the essence of its master.
mainBoard.name: Commander's Sphere
mainBoard.originalText:
{T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color in your commander's color identity.
Sacrifice Commander's Sphere: Draw a card.

rulings.text: If you don't have a commander, Commander's Sphere's first ability produces no mana.
If you have two commanders, the ability adds one mana of any color in their combined color identities.
If your commander is a card that has no colors in its color identity, Commander's Sphere's first ability produces no mana. It doesn't produce {C}.

mainBoard.text:
{T}: Add one mana of any color in your commander's color identity.
Sacrifice Commander's Sphere: Draw a card.

mainBoard.name: Assault Suit

rulings.text: If an effect instructs you to sacrifice a creature, and you control any creatures other than the creature equipped with Assault Suit, you must sacrifice one of them. You can't try to sacrifice the equipped creature, fail, and therefore ignore the effect.

The equipped creature can't be sacrificed for any reason. If an effect instructs you to sacrifice it, you can't and it remains on the battlefield. You also can't sacrifice it to pay a cost that requires you to sacrifice a creature.

mainBoard.flavorText: "The shadow travels toward the apex. I predict we will soon see the true measure of darkness."
mainBoard.name: Seer's Sundial
mainBoard.originalText: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {2}. If you do, draw a card.

rulings.text: The landfall ability triggers whenever a land enters under your control for any reason. It triggers whenever you play a land, as well as whenever a spell or ability (such as Rampant Growth) causes you to put a land onto the battlefield under your control. It will even trigger when a spell or ability causes another player to put a land onto the battlefield under your control (as can happen with Yavimaya Dryad's ability, for example).

When a land enters under your control, each landfall ability of the permanents you control will trigger. You can put them on the stack in any order. The last ability you put on the stack will be the first one that resolves.
You choose whether to pay {2} as the ability resolves. You may pay {2} only once per resolution.

mainBoard.text: Landfall — Whenever a land you control enters, you may pay {2}. If you do, draw a card.

"The scourge of Skyshroud is airborne once more."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

mainBoard.flavorText: Mages come from far and wide to bathe in its wisdom.
mainBoard.name: Loreseeker's Stone
mainBoard.originalText: {3}, {T}: Draw three cards. This ability costs {1} more to activate for each card in your hand.

rulings.text: Use the number of cards in your hand at the time you activate the ability (before drawing three cards) to determine how much mana to add to the activation cost.

mainBoard.text: {3}, {T}: Draw three cards. This ability costs {1} more to activate for each card in your hand.

mainBoard.name: Beastmaster Ascension
mainBoard.originalText:
Whenever a creature you control attacks, you may put a quest counter on Beastmaster Ascension.
As long as Beastmaster Ascension has seven or more quest counters on it, creatures you control get +5/+5.

rulings.text: If you attack with multiple creatures, Beastmaster Ascension's first ability triggers multiple times.

mainBoard.text:
Whenever a creature you control attacks, you may put a quest counter on Beastmaster Ascension.
As long as Beastmaster Ascension has seven or more quest counters on it, creatures you control get +5/+5.

mainBoard.flavorText: Few who encounter the strange, human-like grove leave once the lilting chorus of the dryads reaches their ears.
mainBoard.name: Song of the Dryads
mainBoard.originalText:
Enchant permanent
Enchanted permanent is a colorless Forest land.

rulings.text: If the permanent was an Aura or an Equipment, it becomes unattached from whatever it was attached to.

The enchanted permanent loses any card types, subtypes, and colors it previously had. It keeps any supertypes it had and its name remains unchanged. It gains “{T}: Add {G}” and loses all other abilities from its rules text. It will still have any abilities it gained from other effects.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant permanent
Enchanted permanent is a colorless Forest land.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Knowledge is a stain that only instinct and ferocity can cleanse."
—Drarg, wolfcaller
mainBoard.name: Wolfcaller's Howl
mainBoard.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, create X 2/2 green Wolf creature tokens, where X is the number of your opponents with four or more cards in hand.

rulings.text: Use the number of opponents who have four or more cards in hand as the ability resolves to determine the value of X.

mainBoard.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, create X 2/2 green Wolf creature tokens, where X is the number of your opponents with four or more cards in hand.

mainBoard.flavorText: Deserted, but not uninhabited.
mainBoard.name: Ghost Quarter
mainBoard.originalText:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ghost Quarter: Destroy target land. Its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle his or her library.

rulings.text: If you target Ghost Quarter with its own ability, the ability won't resolve because its target is no longer on the battlefield. You won't get to search for a land card.

If the targeted land is an illegal target by the time Ghost Quarter's ability resolves, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. The land's controller won't get to search for a basic land card.

The target land's controller gets to search for a basic land card even if that land wasn't destroyed by Ghost Quarter's ability. This may happen because the land has indestructible or because it was regenerated.

mainBoard.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice Ghost Quarter: Destroy target land. Its controller may search their library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

mainBoard.flavorText: A ghoulcaller's playground.
mainBoard.name: Haunted Fengraf
mainBoard.originalText:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Haunted Fengraf: Return a creature card at random from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: All players get to see which card you return to your hand.
Because Haunted Fengraf's ability doesn't target any creature card, any creature card put into the graveyard in response to that ability may be returned to your hand.
The creature card returned to your hand is chosen at random as the ability resolves. If any player responds to the ability, that player won't yet know what card will be returned.

mainBoard.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Haunted Fengraf: Return a creature card at random from your graveyard to your hand.

mainBoard.name: Oran-Rief, the Vastwood
mainBoard.originalText:
Oran-Rief, the Vastwood enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each green creature that entered the battlefield this turn.

rulings.text: Oran-Rief's last ability affects all permanents that are green creatures that entered this turn, not just the ones you control.

Oran-Rief's last ability cares about permanents' characteristics at the time the ability resolves, not their characteristics at the time they entered. For example, if a blue creature enters, then is turned green by a spell or ability, then Oran-Rief's second ability resolves, you'll put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.

mainBoard.text:
